title: The armor nerfs are too fucking far.
body:

Yeah, it's total bullshit.  They said that they would be minor nerfs but I see armor getting gutted and by extension AD champs getting a huge buff.  Also say goodbye to tanks in general...

* Randuins got nerfed 10 armor.
* Thornmail was retuned to do the exact same thing on the champs that build it anyway. (No armor nerf btw)
* Frozen Heart got nerfed 10 armor.
* There are cost changes that reflect the general losses of armor.
* a new crit reduction passive on randuins means that full tanks will be harder to kill, and with cheaper items, lower econ tanks will be more common. 
* Just as well the cost changes are meant to mirror the magic resist item costs and levels of effectiveness.
* The standardization of the randuins slow will make it a much better armor item early and slightly weaker late.
* Thornmail actually stacks better with resistances now, making it a very good buy for the people who would be building it anyway.
* Thornmail is now set to do 15% of the damage received + 25% of the wearer's bonus armor as damage. It means that any champion with a natural armor steroid (think Rammus Leona Shyvana) is now set to be even more of a nuisance, which is generally the tankline, while its less effective as a means of an off-build armor buy. (Think adc vayne with thornmail) (And I've seen that shit too so don't tell me it doesn't happen.) 
* I would perhaps use the term power-shift rather than OMGRITONERFTANKSAGAINGGFF20 because these changes don't seem all that bad.

Items didn't get cheaper, all the tank items that got nerfed got more expensive. And on the Thornmail, it's not so much that new thornmail synergizes with stacking more armor, it _requires_ you stack more armor, because that 25% extra damage from bonus armor is peanuts compared to that other 15% reflected AA damage. God help you if the enemy builds Black Cleaver or has a kit with armorshred in it.

"Gutted" Lets do some math.
Lets assume the tank rushed thorn mail and has about 150 Armor (100 bonus). The adc will have around 200 AD, so with the 66% AD reduction, the ADC will do around 66 damage to the tank (not including armor pen due to varying degrees from runes/masteries).
Before the nerf thorn mail would reflect 30% of the damage before armor came into effect, thus reflecting 60 damage. 
After the nerf thorn mail reflects 15% (30) and 25% of the tanks bonus armor (25). Add that together and you get 55 damage compared to 60. 
Looking at the "HUGE NERF" I am surprised that that 5 damage really even means anything to you. Now you might say that that 5 damage stacks many times with an adc that attacks many times. So lets say that the adc attacks you 10 times before you die (because its a teamfight, adc isn't the only one attacking you). that's only 50 damage. Not game breaking by any means. 
This also makes the item more effective against AP/supports/other tanks.
Lets assume that its late game, the enemy apc has 100 AD and you have 300 Armor. They already burst someone else down and kite you using basic attacks while skills are on CD. 
Thorn mail would reflect 15 damage from the enemy AD along with 75 damage from your armor. That means that for every basic attack the enemy APC/tank/support hits you with, they are doing about a whopping 13 damage (87.5% reduction) and taking about 90 damage back from your thorn mail. 

So please before you go complaining about how big the nerf is going to be, actually do the math.
